news.title: Apple Reaches $1 Trillion in Stock-Market Value
news.summary: The Silicon Valley giant became the first U.S.-listed company to surpass $1 trillion in stock-market value, underscoring the iPhone maker’s explosive growth and its role in fueling the rise of the technology industry to the forefront of the global economy.

news.title: White House Aims to Freeze Fuel Standards for Cars
news.summary: The Trump administration is proposing to freeze fuel-efficiency standards for cars and light trucks in 2020, a move that will ease rules for auto makers and likely intensify a legal fight with California.

news.title: U.S. Intelligence Officials Warn of ‘Pervasive’ Russian Efforts to Disrupt 2018 Elections
news.summary: Senior intelligence officials described Russian efforts to interfere in the 2018 midterm elections as deep, real and ongoing, showcasing their efforts to combat a threat President Trump has repeatedly dismissed.

news.title: Kidney Beans Piled to the Rafters: Tariffs Are Biting in Farm Country
news.summary: At Chippewa Valley Bean Co. in Wisconsin, export orders dried up after the EU imposed tariffs in retaliation for America’s on steel and aluminum. The ripples are reaching U.S. vendors and farmers, while in Europe, some bean buyers are looking elsewhere for supplies.
news.byline: Jesse Newman | Photographs by Tim Gruber for The Wall Street Journal

news.title: Thousands of North Korean Workers Enter Russia Despite U.N. Ban
news.summary: Russia is letting thousands of new North Korean laborers enter and issuing fresh work permits—actions U.S. officials say potentially violate sanctions aimed at cutting cash flows to Pyongyang.
news.byline: Ian Talley in Washington and Anatoly Kurmanaev in St. Petersburg, Russia

news.title: Bank of England Raises Rates to Highest Level Since 2009
news.summary: The Bank of England raised its benchmark interest rate for only the second time in a decade, as inflation worries trumped concerns about Brexit and a brewing trade war.

news.title: Google’s Road Back to China Littered With Obstacles
news.summary: Google’s development of a censor-friendly mobile search app sent shares of China’s dominant search engine plunging, but it still faces hurdles gaining re-entry into the country.
news.byline: Liza Lin in Shanghai and Shan Li in Beijing

news.title: Bookkeeper Testifies in Manafort Trial
news.summary: Manafort’s longtime bookkeeper testified that she processed all of the former Trump campaign chief’s personal expenses, but didn’t know about more than a dozen accounts allegedly controlled in Cyprus.
news.byline: Aruna Viswanatha and Del Quentin Wilber

news.title: For Tesla’s Elon Musk, Twitter Is Sword Against Short Sellers
news.summary: Elon Musk’s extraordinary use of Twitter to battle short sellers has often been followed by a jump in Tesla’s stock price, hurting shorts in the process.

news.title: Fiat Chrysler Has to Turn Jeep Around to Compete in China
news.summary: New Fiat Chrysler CEO Mike Manley once promised that China would be its global engine of growth. But the company’s first-half performance there was one of the weakest for any international auto maker.
news.byline: Trefor Moss in Shanghai and Mike Colias in Detroit

news.title: Five Reasons You May Not Want to Retire in a Small Town
news.summary: Ask Encore: Retirees expect “Mayberry.” But they often find something different.

news.title: Will the Smartphone Ever Truly Replace Your Wallet?
news.summary: When ‘there’s an app’ for everything, the contents of our wallets—cash, mementos, timeworn IDs—are giving way to slick digital replacements. Six writers consider why it’s bittersweet to say goodbye to the billfold.

news.title: Crikey, Bruce, Our Aussie Lingo Has Gone Walkabout
news.summary: In a nation that cares deeply about its slang, a divide breaks out over the nickname for a popular pub meal: ”parmy” or ”parma”?

news.title: CBS Posts Higher Profit, Revenue
news.summary: CBS reported better-than-expected revenue for the second quarter, results that come as the media company’s board investigates allegations of sexual harassment against its chairman and chief executive, Leslie Moonves.

news.title: Blue Apron Loses More Customers
news.summary: Blue Apron disclosed increasing customer losses, as the meal-kit maker struggles to fix logistical problems dogging its complex operations.

news.title: GE Engineer Linked to China Stole Power Plant Technology, FBI Says
news.summary: A GE engineer with ties to Chinese companies was arrested for allegedly stealing files related to proprietary power turbine technology, which the FBI says he elaborately concealed to avoid detection.

news.title: Warner Music Pursues Young, Digital Audience With Purchase of Uproxx
news.summary: Warner Music has acquired the pop-culture media website Uproxx in a bid to help it reach young digital audiences and create content beyond music.

news.title: Brookstone Files for Bankruptcy as Web Shoppers Leave It Behind
news.summary: Brookstone, the specialty retailer known for selling massage chairs, travel gadgets and other novelties at malls and airports, filed for bankruptcy protection and said it would close its 102 mall-based stores.

news.title: Sears Franchise Owners Get Caught in Retailer’s Woes
news.summary: Dozens of Sears franchises that offer carpet cleaning, garage repair and other services have closed in the past year. Some former and current franchisees blame the parent company’s financial troubles.

news.title: Teva’s Sales Slump 18%
news.summary: The Israeli generic-drugs maker said it faces further demand weakness in North America, and its blockbuster Copaxone multiple-sclerosis treatment is contending with more competition.

news.title: Carl Icahn Is Right About Cigna and Express Scripts
news.summary: Strong second-quarter results suggest Cigna doesn’t need to pursue big deals.

news.title: Cisco Adds to Cybersecurity Offerings With Purchase of Duo
news.summary: Cisco Systems agreed to pay $2.35 billion for privately held Duo Security, a move intended to bolster cybersecurity offerings at the networking gear giant.

news.title: More Schools Buy ‘Active-Shooter’ Insurance Policies
news.summary: Schools consider the likelihood of a shooting real enough that some districts are buying active-shooter insurance to cover legal expenses and other costs in the event of a mass shooting.

news.title: With GOP District in Jeopardy, Trump to Stump in Ohio Vote
news.summary: President Trump is heading to central Ohio Saturday to shore up support for a Republican House candidate who has struggled to raise money and is failing to motivate GOP voters.

news.title: Speaker Maker Sonos Soars on Debut
news.summary: Speaker company Sonos’s stock traded at $18.57 on Thursday afternoon, nearly 24% higher than its initial public offering price, in its market debut.

news.title: Turkey Needs Foreign Funds as Short-Term Debt Looms
news.summary: Turkey has big piles of foreign-denominated debt and its plunging currency shows only the bravest are choosing to stick around.

news.title: AIG’s Income Slid in Second Quarter
news.summary: The insurer posted a 17% decline in second-quarter net income, weighed down by a $200 million pretax restructuring charge.

news.title: Regulators Probe Options Market’s Major Clearinghouse
news.summary: The company tasked with curbing risk in the U.S. options market is under investigation by federal regulators for how it handled a recent period of market turbulence.

news.title: ‘I’m Totally Freaked Out’: Brazilians Weigh a Farewell to Paradise Amid Violence
news.summary: With gun violence surging, along with pessimism about the country’s political and economic future, the number of Brazilians who are emigrating is soaring.

news.title: U.S., Mexico Pursue Nafta Auto Deal as Canada Sits on Sidelines
news.summary: Senior U.S. and Mexican officials sought to hammer out new rules for the auto trade at the center of negotiations to overhaul Nafta, while Canadian officials sat out the latest talks amid tension between Ottawa and Washington.

news.title: Pope Calls for Death Penalty Abolition
news.summary: Pope Francis formally strengthened Catholic Church teaching against capital punishment, categorically prohibiting it as an attack on human dignity.

news.title: Police Raid Zimbabwe Opposition
news.summary: Police raided the offices of Zimbabwe’s main opposition party, as the death toll grew from clashes over the slow release of presidential-election results.

news.title: Indonesia’s Election Spells Trouble for Oil and Gas Companies
news.summary: Indonesia’s election season is spelling trouble for foreign resource companies, with Chevron becoming the latest to lose prized assets to a state company.

news.title: What Keeps CIOs Up at Night?
news.summary: Pretty much everything—including how to measure the actual security risks, who has access to the system and whether business partners can be trusted.

news.title: Remember the Age of Paper Ballots? It’s Back
news.summary: To maintain election integrity, local governments are looking  to the past to make sure the future is secure.

news.title: The Anatomy of a Phishing Attack
news.summary: From surveillance to the payoff, here’s how hackers use employees to gain access to a company’s computer system.

news.title: Vote for the WSJ House of the Week
news.summary: Will it be a restored château in the French countryside, a modern East Hampton retreat or a rustic family barn in California?

news.title: China Says U.S. Trade Pressure Won’t Work
news.summary: China fired back after the Trump administration threatened to double proposed tariffs on $200 billion in Chinese goods, saying it won’t yield to White House pressure.

news.title: North Korea’s Kim Sends Letter to Trump; Contents Not Disclosed
news.summary: President Trump received a new letter from North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, according to the White House, which didn’t disclose its contents but characterized it as the next step in negotiations over North Korea’s nuclear arsenal.

news.title: Bank of Mexico Leaves Interest Rates Unchanged
news.summary: The Bank of Mexico left interest rates unchanged, saying it expects the effects of higher energy costs will be temporary, with core inflation continuing to ease.

news.title: Israel Says It Killed Suspected Islamic State-Linked Militants
news.summary: Israel’s military killed seven suspected Islamic State-affiliated militants in territory it controls near the border with Syria, reflecting the risk of spillover as the Assad regime presses a military campaign to retake the country’s southwest.
news.byline: Felicia Schwartz in Tel Aviv and Raja Abdulrahim in Beirut

news.title: Japan Medical School Accused of Rigging Exams to Keep Out Women
news.summary: Tokyo Medical University is looking to investigate an allegation that the school lowered the entrance-exam results of female applicants to ensure that most of the entrants were men.

news.title: Zimbabwe Calls In Military as Protests Erupt Over Vote Counting
news.summary: President Emmerson Mnangagwa, who deposed strongman Robert Mugabe and sought to end Zimbabwe’s pariah status, called in the army to violently disperse protesters angered by delays in announcing the winner of the presidential election.

news.title: U.K., EU Are Replaying Historical Debates
news.summary: When Theresa May visits French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday, she will be proposing that the U.K. will continue to follow some EU regulations, but what she wants is an intergovernmental relationship based on both sides retaining full sovereignty. She isn’t the first British prime minister to make such a bid.

news.title: Canada Scales Back Carbon-Tax Plans
news.summary: Canada’s Liberal government is scaling back elements of its planned carbon-tax regime to address worries from the business community about global competition.

news.title: As Israel Enshrines Its Jewish Identity, Its Druze Minority Feels Abandoned
news.summary: Former senior military and police chiefs are pressing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to revise a law enshrining the country as a Jewish nation-state to include the Druze, an ethnic minority who view the legislation as an affront to their contributions to the military.

news.title: Russia Seeks U.S. Help in Returning Syria Refugees
news.summary: Russia unveiled new efforts Wednesday to bring refugees back to Syria and called on the U.S. to help back its relocation efforts following a summit between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in which both leaders backed the goal.

news.title: Saudi Arabia Detains More Women’s Rights Activists
news.summary: Authorities have detained two women’s rights activists, human-rights groups said, broadening a campaign of arrests that has tainted the kingdom’s reforms agenda.

news.title: Kazakh Court Frees Woman in Case That Shed Light on Chinese Camps
news.summary: A court in Kazakhstan ruled that an ethnic Kazakh Chinese national should not be deported to China, in a case seen as a test of concern in Central Asia over Beijing’s treatment of China’s Muslim minority.

news.title: Japan’s Women and Seniors Keep a Lid on Wages
news.summary: The Bank of Japan says employers are finding it relatively easy to attract the elderly and women to the workforce with only small wage increases, capping overall wage growth and, in turn, suppressing prices and inflation expectations.

news.title: Xi’s Right-Hand Man Is Message-Bearer in China-U.S. Trade Dispute
news.summary: Wang Qishan, China’s vice president and a confidant of President Xi Jinping, has emerged as a message-bearer to visiting Americans at a time that China’s rivalry with the U.S. is intensifying over international influence, military affairs and trade.

news.title: U.S. Pressures China With Punitive Trade, Defense Measures
news.summary: The Trump administration is threatening to more than double proposed tariffs on imports, while Congress passed a defense bill designed to restrict Beijing’s activity.

news.title: Insurers Seek Smaller Rate Increases on ACA Plans
news.summary: After years of big rate increases on Affordable Care Act plans, insurers in many states are seeking smaller hikes and even some reductions, according to new federal data.
news.byline: Anna Wilde Mathews and Joseph Walker

news.title: Pence Says Return of Remains Shows U.S. Progress on North Korea
news.summary: Vice President Mike Pence credited North Korean leader Kim Jong Un with fulfilling a promise to return the remains of some U.S. troops killed during the Korean War.

news.title: Aide to Former Trump Adviser Roger Stone Must Testify, Judge Rules
news.summary: Andrew Miller had challenged a subpoena from Special Counsel Robert Mueller. Meanwhile, the special counsel is negotiating terms of a possible interview with the Azerbaijani pop star involved in the June 2016 Trump Tower meeting.

news.title: New York Pushes Back Against Insurer Premium Increases
news.summary: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo is pushing back against health insurers that want to raise premium rates after the repeal of the federal law requiring individuals to have insurance, while New Jersey officials said they avoided such hikes by making the mandate state law.

news.title: White House Picks Another CIA Veteran as a Top Leader
news.summary: The White House on Wednesday named Vaughn Bishop, a career agency officer, as its new deputy director, marking an unusual leadership structure that has two longtime agency veterans at its helm.
news.byline: Nancy A. Youssef and Dustin Volz

news.title: Trump Puts Pressure on Sessions to End Russia Probe ‘Now’
news.summary: President Trump urged Attorney General Jeff Sessions to end the Russia investigation “right now,” as negotiations continued between his lawyers and special counsel Robert Mueller over the terms of a possible interview..
news.byline: Michael C. Bender and Sadie Gurman

news.title: Vendors Testify of Manafort’s High-End Purchases Paid by Overseas Wire Transfers
news.summary: A stream of vendors testified they had done high-end work for former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort and were paid through overseas transfers.
news.byline: Aruna Viswanatha and Del Quentin Wilber

news.title: U.S. Penalizes Turkish Officials for Pastor’s Detention
news.summary: The U.S. placed sanctions on Turkey’s ministers of justice and interior over the detention of an American pastor.
news.byline: Michael C. Bender and Dion Nissenbaum

news.title: Senators Propose Curbing Trump’s National-Security Tariff Power
news.summary: GOP Sen. Rob Portman of Ohio is proposing legislation that would make it harder for the White House to impose the sort of duties that have already hit metals imports and sparked a global backlash.

news.title: Court Rules Bid to Withhold Aid From Sanctuary Cities Is Unconstitutional
news.summary: A federal appeals court ruled that President Trump’s executive order threatening to withhold federal funding from sanctuary cities is unconstitutional, dealing a setback to his push for more aggressive immigration enforcement.

news.title: Senate Republicans Block $250 Million Election Security Measure
news.summary: Senate Republicans blocked an amendment that would have sent grants to states to bolster cybersecurity efforts and replaced outdated voting equipment, preferring to wait to see how they spend funds appropriated earlier this year.

news.title: Trump Considers Slashing Number of Refugees Allowed to Resettle in U.S.
news.summary: The Trump administration is considering slashing the number of refugees it allows to come to the U.S. next year by as much as 44% as it looks to tighten its immigration crackdown, a senior administration official said.

news.title: Defense Bill Aims to Counter China
news.summary: Congress passed a defense-policy bill that some lawmakers say is tougher on China than any in history, as a bipartisan movement to confront Beijing gathers steam.

news.title: White House Loosens Rules on Cheap Health Plans
news.summary: The Trump administration, in one of its most significant efforts to roll back the Affordable Care Act, has released a rule that will allow for the proliferation of cheaper, less-comprehensive health plans.
news.byline: Stephanie Armour and Thomas M. Burton

news.title: On the Ballot in Some States Ahead of 2020: The Right to Vote
news.summary: Voters will get the chance this fall to decide whether to expand or limit access to the polls in a wave of ballot initiatives ahead of the 2020 presidential election.

news.title: Kavanaugh Has Often Favored Employers in Labor Cases
news.summary: Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh thought SeaWorld shouldn’t be sanctioned for the death of a trainer and an employer shouldn’t have to bargain with a union that included undocumented immigrants.

news.title: Cuomo Takes Step Toward Legalizing Recreational Marijuana in New York
news.summary: Gov. Andrew Cuomo took another step toward legalizing marijuana in New York, announcing the formation of a 20-person group to draft legislation allowing for recreational use by adults.

news.title: NYC Health Czar Stepping Down to Take Harvard University Post
news.summary: New York City health commissioner Mary Travis Bassett announced Thursday that she will be leaving her job at the end of the month to take a position at Harvard University.

news.title: Corruption Retrial of Former Union Boss Kicks Off in Manhattan
news.summary: The retrial of Norman Seabrook began with arguments over whether the onetime union leader’s risky investment of $20 million—which ultimately lost $19 million—was a corrupt deal or an unfortunate financial strategy.

news.title: New York Tenants-Rights Group Lifts Profile but Has Little Success in Lawsuits
news.summary: The nonprofit Housing Rights Initiative has organized more than 45 lawsuits challenging landlords on behalf of New York City’s tenants but hasn’t fared well in court.

news.title: Gun Advocates to Repost 3-D Weapon Plans
news.summary: Hours after a federal judge forced a group in Texas to remove online blueprints for 3-D printed firearms on Tuesday, gun-rights groups in California said they were publishing the files on a separate website.

news.title: Murphy Administration Amps Up Environmental Enforcement
news.summary: New Jersey officials on Wednesday filed six lawsuits against companies accused of polluting, marking an increase in environmental enforcement under Gov. Phil Murphy.

news.title: New York City Fare-Beaters Get a Slide in the Subway
news.summary: Fare-evaders with open summons warrants who are stopped by police for turnstile jumping won’t be arrested but will instead get a ride to court to deal with their cases, New York Police Department officials said.
news.byline: Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Melanie Grayce West

news.title: Longtime Director’s Exit Leaves Big Void at MoMA PS1
news.summary: Now that Klaus Biesenbach is leaving MoMA PS1 after more than two decades, the Long Island City contemporary-art institution is faced with the tough task of forging a new path.

news.title: Pennsylvania Catholic Diocese Identifies Priests Accused of Child Sexual Abuse
news.summary: The list names 71 priests and church personnel accused of abuse dating back to the 1940s.

news.title: Police Union Hosts Protest Targeting Mayor to Mark Year Without a Contract
news.summary: Hundreds of New York City police officers rallied on the steps of City Hall, holding up signs and orange foam fingers that said “LIAR,” to mark a year since they’ve been working without a contract.

news.title: U.S. Charges Ukrainians in Hacking Case
news.summary: U.S. prosecutors announced the arrests of three Ukrainians accused of being leaders of an international ring that has allegedly hacked millions of payment card records in a campaign of cyberattacks that targeted over 100 American companies.

news.title: New York City Targets Ride-Hailing Services
news.summary: Bills were formally presented to New York City Council that could raise driver wages and freeze new licenses for ride-hailing vehicles for one year.

news.title: New York City’s Neighborhood Policing Goes Underground
news.summary: New York City’s neighborhood-policing program takes to the subways, with early results mixed as officers seek to build relationships with straphangers. Some are a tough sell.
news.byline: Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Gerald Porter Jr.

news.title: Cupertino Council Balks at Tax After Apple Objects
news.summary: The city of Cupertino, home to Apple, backed down from a proposal for a per-employee tax on big companies, after opposition from local businesses and a direct appeal from Apple to consider alternatives.

news.title: Will a Psych Major Pay? The Government Wants to Know
news.summary: Trump administration is moving to require that colleges and universities publish more detailed data on the finances of their graduates, part of a broader effort to make higher education more market driven.
news.byline: Michelle Hackman, Josh Mitchell and Douglas Belkin

news.title: Unsealed Suit Details Deal Between GOP Fundraiser, Ex-Playboy Model
news.summary: A California court unsealed a lawsuit filed by a former Playboy centerfold who says a GOP fundraiser reneged on a 2017 agreement to pay her $1.6 million to keep quiet about an affair and pregnancy.

news.title: In California, More Fires Prompt Evacuations
news.summary: New wildfires and more evacuations hit California, with nearly 20,000 homes under threat and 44,000 residents forced to evacuate mostly in the hardest-hit northern part of the Golden State.

news.title: Fake Accounts Latched On to Real U.S. Protest Groups
news.summary: Organizers of fake Facebook accounts sought to work alongside legitimate groups organizing protests in the U.S., a new strategy in efforts to sow discord through social media.

news.title: New Facebook and Instagram Tools Aim to Curb Your Binge
news.summary: As part of a larger trend of tech companies helping to wean users off their more-addictive products, Facebook has announced new tools that tally time spent and nudge you when it’s time for a break.

news.title: Facebook’s New Message to WhatsApp: Make Money
news.summary: WhatsApp detailed plans to sell ads and charge big companies that want to reach their customers through its service, launching its first major revenue streams as growth at Facebook’s main app is starting to decelerate.

news.title: High Prices Propel Apple, Sink Samsung
news.summary: Apple and Samsung are betting on super-high prices for their flagship products. The strategy has energized Apple but sapped Samsung’s sales.

news.title: T-Mobile, Sprint Add Customers as They Push Toward Merger
news.summary: T-Mobile and Sprint added a wave of new customers as they await regulators’ approval for a merger that would put their combined subscriber base on par with their wireless rivals.

news.title: Square Report Smaller Loss as Consumer Push Intensifies
news.summary: Jack Dorsey’s Square Inc. said on Wednesday that its second-quarter loss narrowed by nearly two-thirds thanks in part to uptake of its consumer financial services.

news.title: Kroger to Launch Grocery Delivery Service
news.summary: Kroger is launching a grocery delivery service, its fourth e-commerce offensive in less than three months, as the U.S.’s largest supermarket chain seeks to remain relevant in a fiercely competitive grocery sector.

news.title: China Names New Internet Overseer
news.summary: Beijing appointed a new director for its powerful internet regulator, elevating an official seen as an associate of President Xi Jinping to a post with censorship responsibilities and huge sway over tech companies.

news.title: Facebook Pulls Accounts That Mimic Russian Tactics Ahead of Election
news.summary: Facebook said it deleted a new group of politically oriented accounts that were engaged in coordinated misinformation efforts ahead of the U.S. midterm elections.

news.title: Uber Partner Grab Flags Down $2 Billion Investment
news.summary: Southeast Asian ride-hailing company Grab said Thursday it raised $2 billion in a round of fundraising, providing extra firepower to confront a new challenge to its regional position.

news.title: Ready, Aim, Hire a ‘Fortnite’ Coach: Parents Enlist Videogame Tutors for Their Children
news.summary: It’s not the violence or the addiction of the hit game that bothers mom and dad—it’s the losing.

news.title: Elon Musk Rebuts Critics, Teases Ideas and Stirs Controversy in 4,925 Tweets
news.summary: Tweeting @elonmusk? There’s a good chance he’ll reply to you, and the chief executive of Tesla isn’t afraid to court controversy when tweeting to his over 22 million followers. But don’t take him “too seriously.”

news.title: Resistance Builds to Google’s ‘Smart City’ in Toronto
news.summary: An Alphabet project aimed at creating a “smart city” on Toronto’s waterfront is facing resistance from local officials who are worried about the development’s direction and how Google’s parent company will handle residents’ personal data.

news.title: Ousted Tech Founder? Uber’s Travis Kalanick Is in Good Company
news.summary: Uber co-Founder Travis Kalanick joins an illustrious list of Silicon Valley leaders forced out of running the companies they built.

news.title: Uber’s Really Bad Year
news.summary: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick’s resignation follows a turbulent few months for both him and the company he founded. Here’s a quick glance at the events that preceded the 40-year-old’s departure.

news.title: Should I Sanitize My Smartphone?
news.summary: For all the grime that gets on our devices, the occasional wipe down might not be enough. These glowing gadgets give them a deeper clean.

news.title: This Camera Crushes Your Phone—and Still Fits in Your Pocket
news.summary: The remarkable thing about Sony’s new RX100 is that it packs so many features into a body much closer in size to a smartphone than a chunky DSLR. At $1,200 it’s pricey, writes David Pierce, but the RX100 VI may be the best camera you can take anywhere.

news.title: Biggest Companies’ Secret to Success: Their Tech Spending
news.summary: The secret of success for Amazon, Google and Microsoft is how much they invest in their own technology.

news.title: Google Considering Return to China With Censored Search
news.summary: Google is testing a mobile version of its search engine that would adhere to China’s strict controls over content, a person familiar with the matter said, indicating renewed interest in a market it abandoned eight years ago in protest over government censorship.

news.title: Tesla Puts Profits in Its Sights This Year
news.summary: Tesla doubled its loss in the second quarter but burned less cash than expected, alleviating some pressure as the electric-car maker seeks to deliver a profit later this year.

news.title: Tesla Earnings: What to Watch
news.summary: Tesla is expected to release second-quarter financial results after the market closes Wednesday. Here’s what you need to know.

news.title: China’s Baidu Credits Artificial Intelligence for Robust Ad Sales
news.summary: Baidu has had its share of challenges in recent years, including turmoil in its executive ranks, but bets on artificial intelligence to drive ad sales appear to be paying off.
news.byline: Shan Li in Beijing and Maria Armental in New York

news.title: Apple’s iPhones Power Results
news.summary: Apple delivered its best-ever revenue for the June quarter, typically its weakest period, as demand for high-price iPhones remained resilient and services such as app-store sales swelled to a record.

news.title: Samsung’s Mobile Profit Falls as Consumers Balk at Costly Phones
news.summary: Fewer buyers than expected have shelled out top dollar for Samsung’s new flagship device, the Galaxy S9.

news.title: Qualcomm to Buy Back $10 Billion of Its Shares
news.summary: Qualcomm unveiled the first part of a share buyback program authorized last week after scrapping a bid to buy NXP Semiconductors.

news.title: Apple Comes Under Media Fire in China Amid Rising Trade Tensions
news.summary: Chinese state media claims the U.S. tech giant isn’t doing enough to block texts and images trafficking in prohibited content.

news.title: Nintendo Operating Profit Jumps 88% Despite Softer Switch Sales
news.summary: Nintendo said its operating profit nearly doubled in the fiscal first quarter as strong game-software sales more than offset a falloff for its main Switch game console. Net profit was up 44%.

news.title: Trump Administration Cuts Newsprint Tariffs
news.summary: Levies of up to 32% on paper from Canada are lowered, giving a partial reprieve to the beleaguered U.S. newspaper industry

news.title: Apollo’s Earnings Miss Analyst Views as Growth Slows
news.summary: Apollo Global Management reported earnings below analysts’ forecasts, as the investment firm posted slower growth in the value of its private-equity portfolio.

news.title: Sempra Energy Leads 11 Utilities in Management Top 250
news.summary: Company is No. 68 overall, boosted by strength in employee engagement and development.

news.title: U.S. Recycling Companies Face Upheaval From China Scrap Ban
news.summary: Top waste-services companies say their recycling operations are a drag on earnings as business with their biggest foreign market disappears.

news.title: Kellogg Raises Full-Year Guidance On Stronger Second Quarter
news.summary: Kellogg offered a bullish outlook for its annual sales after several sluggish years, but it warned that higher trucking costs and lower prices for its products were eating into profit margins.

news.title: Cushman & Wakefield Shares Rise in NYSE Debut
news.summary: Shares of Cushman & Wakefield, a brokerage and real-estate-services firm, opened at $18 in their first day of trading, up 5.9% from its initial public offering price.

news.title: Discovery Channel Founder Pivots After Seeing Limits of Cord-Cutter Bonanza
news.summary: CuriosityStream will add advertising and lower subscription price after slower-than-expected subscription growth

news.title: XPO Logistics Pares Acquisition List to ‘About a Dozen’ Targets
news.summary: Gaining from strong freight market, the logistics operator built through a series of deals says it expects ‘one or two’ purchases.

news.title: BMW Weighs Measures to Counter Tariff Impact
news.summary: German auto maker BMW said it was drawing up plans to navigate rising global trade barriers days after it raised prices on some cars it sells in China because of newly imposed import tariffs.

news.title: Recovering Agriculture Business Helps DowDuPont’s Top Line
news.summary: Sales in DowDuPont’s agriculture business rebounded in the latest quarter from the late planting season, which helped boost the chemical giant’s topline compared with a year ago.

news.title: Ad Giant Omnicom Agrees to Buy Small Consulting Firm
news.summary: Omnicom Group has agreed to acquire Dallas-based consulting firm Credera, the latest instance of an ad-services business investing in consulting services.

news.title: Facebook Gives Local Newspapers Tips on How to Boost Subscriptions
news.summary: A Facebook-led program to help local publishers sign up more subscribers is proving to be a rare bright spot in the social-media giant’s often uneasy relationship with the news industry.

news.title: Tech Stocks Lift S&P 500
news.summary: Shares of technology companies rallied to lift the S&P 500, even as investors grappled with the Trump administration’s threat to deepen its trade spat with China.

news.title: Once Billed as a Mideast Financial Haven, Dubai Turns Investors Wary
news.summary: Investors are questioning whether Dubai’s young financial center can police itself as the meltdown of its marquee private-equity firm highlights broader concerns about placing money in the region.

news.title: What Does Your Homeowners Policy Cover in Disasters? Often, Not Enough
news.summary: When the floodwaters have receded and fires have burned out, many U.S. homeowners are hit with another disaster: inadequate insurance. Here is a look at some common issues and suggestions for solutions.

news.title: Stories About FANGs Have Bite
news.summary: The past two weeks have shown both why the broader FANG+ grouping makes little sense, and at the same time how important it is to the bigger debate over “value” vs. growth stocks.

news.title: Trump’s Narrow Window for Trade Wins in China

CSuite.title: Experian Enlists Machine Learning to Gauge App Performance
CSuite.summary: Just as manufacturing firms add sensors to monitor the performance of generators and compressors, Experian is using machine learning to create behavior models of applications. When data indicates behavior outside the normal range, application or infrastructure teams receive an alert. “I would equate this to predictive maintenance,” said CIO Barry Libenson.

CSuite.title: The Morning Download: IT Charity Begins at Home
CSuite.summary: If you consider your primary duty as an IT executive to spearhead digital transformation across the company,  you might be doing it wrong.

CSuite.title: In Rush Toward ‘Digital Transformation,’ Corporations Often Skirt IT
CSuite.summary: In the rush to deploy AI, automation and other tools for business-side divisions, many corporate IT units are neglecting their own digital upgrades, a Hackett Group report says.  That can spell trouble for the entire company.

CSuite.title: Hertz Names New CIO as Tech Overhaul Continues
CSuite.summary: Opal Perry joins the rental-car agency as it continues a massive consolidation of its business systems and prepares to roll out updated versions of its core technology.

CSuite.title: Firms to Boost Spending on Smart Automation
CSuite.summary: In the rush to deploy artificial intelligence and robotic process automation, many businesses lack the in-house skills or business strategies to make those investments pay off, KPMG says.

CSuite.title: Pentagon Signs $885 Million Artificial Intelligence Contract with Booz Allen
CSuite.summary: The U.S. Department of Defense will for the first time be using large-scale AI systems that could automate mundane tasks and augment the work of military members. The contract also will go toward expanding AI-focused pilot programs, including using AI to find new approaches for treating traumatic brain injuries.

CSuite.title: Microsoft CTO: Edge Computing Can Make Industries ‘Massively More Efficient’
CSuite.summary: “Any of these agricultural or industrial applications, where you have very manual processes like inspections, or humans gathering data … (that’s where) the intelligent edge is going to make those industries massively more efficient,” says Microsoft CTO Kevin Scott.

CSuite.title: What Machine Learning Can and Cannot Do
CSuite.summary: As its domain of applications continues to expand, machine learning is raising serious concerns on its impact on automation and the future of work, CIO Journal Columnist Irving Wladawsky-Berger writes.

CSuite.title: Dow Chemical Digital Chief Helps Shape Massive Restructuring
CSuite.summary: Melanie Kalmar, Dow Chemical’s CDO and CIO, is working closely with other senior leaders to create a new structure designed to help the 121-year-old company better compete in the 21st century. "We are focused on a whole new realm of digitalization – one where we are harnessing the power of our long history of data collection to drive growth and new business opportunities," she said.

CSuite.title: Rush to the Cloud Creates Risk of Overspending
CSuite.summary: By purchasing more cloud computing capacity then they really need, companies across all industries may be overspending on cloud services by an average of 42%, a cloud optimization firm finds.

CSuite.title: Dow Jones Develops Automated Security Tool
CSuite.summary: The new tool, called Hammer, was developed partly in response to the growing need for automation amid talent shortages and the fast-paced nature of software development, said Dow Jones CISO Jaswinder Hayre.

CSuite.title: Cloud Migration Set to Ramp Up in China
CSuite.summary: Compared to U.S. companies, businesses in China have been slower to embrace cloud computing, citing the cost and complexity of migrations, as well as added security and regulatory issues, McKinsey reports.

CSuite.title: Walmart CIO Looks to Microsoft Cloud as Vehicle in Digital Race
CSuite.summary: Walmart CIO Clay Johnson said the company’s new pact with Microsoft will allow the retailer to take advantage of artificial intelligence and cloud capabilities as it competes in a rapidly changing market.

CSuite.title: The Houston Astros and the Transformative Power of Analytics
CSuite.summary: The next wave in baseball? Quite possibly big data combined with AI, says CIO Journal Columnist Irving Wladawsky-Berger.

CSuite.title: Intuition, Emotional Skills of Humans Will Still Prevail in the Age of AI, Experts Say

CSuite.title: Firms Look to Emerging Tech to Drive New Business Models

CSuite.title: Akzo Nobel Bets on Data to Hike Prices

CSuite.title: New U.K. Governance Code Focuses on Reporting, Executive Remuneration

CSuite.title: How CFO Paul Woolf Steered Mitie to a Turnaround

CSuite.title: WD-40 Feels Little Impact from Trade Tensions
